text: What is the maximum permissible blood alcohol concentration (BAC) for drivers in most states?
What is the proper way to take a turn?
choices: Accelerate through the turn.
Brake hard before the turn.
Slow down before the turn, then accelerate through it.
Maintain speed through the turn.

text: What is the speed limit in residential areas in most states?
choices: 25 mph
35 mph
45 mph
55 mph

text: What should you do when you approach a railroad crossing?
choices: Speed up to cross the tracks quickly.
Slow down and look both ways.
Honk your horn to warn other drivers.
Ignore the crossing if the gates are up.

text: What is the proper way to park on a hill?
choices: Park with your wheels facing uphill.
Park with your wheels facing downhill.
Park parallel to the curb.
It doesn't matter which way your wheels are facing.

text: What is the minimum following distance you should maintain from the car in front of you?
choices: 5 seconds
2 seconds
1 second
10 seconds

text: What should you do if you miss your exit on the highway?
choices: Make a U-turn and go back.
Stop on the shoulder and wait for help.
Exit at the next available off-ramp and turn around.
Continue driving until you reach your destination.

text: What is the proper way to change lanes?
choices: Signal, check mirrors, and change lanes.
Change lanes without signaling.
Check mirrors, then signal and change lanes.
Change lanes quickly to avoid slowing down.

text: What should you do if you are involved in a car accident?
choices: Drive away from the scene.
Exchange information with the other driver.
Ignore the other driver and continue driving.
Call the police and report the accident.

text: What is the maximum speed limit on most highways?
choices: 50 mph
60 mph
70 mph
80 mph

text: What should you do if your brakes fail while driving?
choices: Pump the brakes rapidly.
Shift into neutral and steer to a safe location.
Turn off the engine and coast to a stop.
Turn on the hazard lights and stop immediately.

text: What does a yellow traffic light mean?
choices: Stop if it is safe to do so.
Slow down and prepare to stop.
Proceed with caution.
Speed up to avoid running the light.

text: What should you do if you encounter a pedestrian crossing the street?
choices: Honk your horn to warn them.
Swerve to avoid hitting them.
Slow down or stop to let them cross.
Continue driving without stopping.

text: What is the proper way to use your turn signals?
choices: Signal before you start turning.
Signal while you are turning.
Signal after you have completed the turn.
You don't need to use turn signals.

text: What should you do if you see a school bus with its red lights flashing?
choices: Stop and wait until the red lights stop flashing.
Slow down and proceed with caution.
Pass the bus quickly.
Ignore the bus and continue driving.

text: What should you do if you are driving and it starts to rain?
choices: Turn on your high beams.
Turn on your hazard lights.
Increase your speed to get to your destination faster.
Slow down and increase your following distance.

text: What should you do if you are driving and your car starts to skid?
choices: Brake hard and steer in the opposite direction.
Take your foot off the gas and steer in the direction you want to go.
Accelerate and steer in the direction you want to go.
Jump out of the car and roll away.

text: What should you do if you have a tire blowout while driving?
choices: Brake hard and come to a stop.
Swerve back and forth to maintain control.
Take your foot off the gas and steer to a safe location.
Accelerate and try to get off the road quickly.

text: What should you do if you are driving and a vehicle in front of you is moving slowly?
choices: Honk your horn to get them to speed up.
Tailgate them to encourage them to move faster.
Pass them when it is safe to do so.
Stay behind them and maintain a safe following distance.

text: What should you do if you are driving and a warning light comes on in your car?
choices: Ignore it and keep driving.
Take your car to a mechanic as soon as possible.
Turn off your car and call for a tow truck.
Speed up to get to your destination before the car breaks down.

text: What should you do if you are driving and a fire breaks out in your car?
choices: Stop the car and try to put out the fire.
Open the windows and doors to let the fire out.
Drive to the nearest gas station to get help.
Pull over to a safe location and evacuate the car.

text: What should you do if you are driving and a strong gust of wind hits your car?
choices: Brake hard and come to a stop.
Steer in the direction of the wind.
Take your foot off the gas and grip the steering wheel firmly.
Accelerate to get through the wind faster.

text: What should you do if you are driving and a traffic light is out of order?
choices: Treat it as a stop sign.
Ignore it and keep driving.
Proceed through the intersection with caution.
Speed up to get through the intersection faster.

text: What should you do if you are driving and a pedestrian is crossing the street at a crosswalk?
choices: Honk your horn to warn them.
Slow down or stop to let them cross.
Speed up to get through the crosswalk faster.
Swerve to avoid hitting them.

text: What should you do if you are driving and a bicyclist is riding in front of you?
choices: Honk your horn to get them to move over.
Tailgate them to encourage them to ride faster.
Pass them when it is safe to do so.
Stay behind them and maintain a safe following distance.

text: What should you do if your car starts to overheat?
choices: Turn on the air conditioning to cool down the engine.
Stop the car and let it cool down before continuing.
Pour water over the engine to cool it down.
Accelerate to get to your destination faster.

text: What should you do if you are driving and your car's accelerator pedal gets stuck?
choices: Brake hard and come to a stop.
Shift into neutral and steer to a safe location.
Turn off the engine and coast to a stop.
Accelerate to get through the problem faster.

text: What should you do if you are driving and a tire blows out?
choices: Brake hard and come to a stop.
Swerve back and forth to maintain control.
Take your foot off the gas and steer to a safe location.
Accelerate and try to get off the road quickly.

text: What should you do if you are driving and a warning light comes on in your car?
choices: Ignore it and keep driving.
Take your car to a mechanic as soon as possible.
Turn off your car and call for a tow truck.
Speed up to get to your destination before the car breaks down.

text: What should you do if you are driving and your brakes fail?
choices: Pump the brakes rapidly.
Shift into neutral and steer to a safe location.
Turn off the engine and coast to a stop.
Accelerate to get through the problem faster.

text: What should you do if you are driving and a deer runs in front of your car?
choices: Brake hard and swerve to avoid hitting the deer.
Accelerate to get through the situation faster.
Honk your horn to scare the deer away.
Stay on course and hit the deer if necessary.

text: What should you do if you are driving and your headlights go out?
choices: Turn on your high beams.
Turn on your hazard lights.
Turn on your fog lights.
Pull over to a safe location and fix the problem.

text: What should you do if you are driving and feel drowsy?
choices: Turn up the radio to stay awake.
Roll down the windows to get fresh air.
Stop and take a nap.
Drink caffeine to stay alert.

text: What should you do if you are driving and a car is following you too closely?
choices: Brake suddenly to get the car to back off.
Speed up to get away from the car.
Move to the right lane and let the car pass.
Stay in your current lane and ignore the car.

text: What should you do if you are driving and a car is coming towards you in your lane?
choices: Brake hard and come to a stop.
Swerve to avoid the car.
Accelerate to get through the situation faster.
Flash your headlights to warn the other driver.

text: What should you do if you are driving and a tire blows out?
choices: Brake hard and come to a stop.
Swerve back and forth to maintain control.
Take your foot off the gas and steer to a safe location.
Accelerate and try to get off the road quickly.

text: What should you do if you are driving and your steering wheel becomes unresponsive?
choices: Brake hard and come to a stop.
Accelerate to get through the situation faster.
Turn off the engine and coast to a stop.
Shift into neutral and steer to a safe location.

text: What should you do if you are driving and your car starts to hydroplane on a wet road?
choices: Brake hard and come to a stop.
Accelerate to get through the situation faster.
Steer in the direction of the skid.
Take your foot off the gas and steer to a safe location.

text: What should you do if you are driving and your car's headlights are not working properly?
choices: Ignore the problem and keep driving.
Turn on your high beams.
Turn on your fog lights.
Pull over to a safe location and fix the problem.

text: What should you do if you are driving and your car starts to skid on ice?
choices: Brake hard and come to a stop.
Accelerate to get through the situation faster.
Steer in the direction of the skid.
Turn off the engine and coast to a stop.

text: What should you do if you are driving and your car's battery dies?
choices: Disconnect the battery and reconnect it.
Call a tow truck to jumpstart the battery.
Push the car to a safe location and jumpstart the battery.
Replace the battery yourself.

text: What should you do if you are driving and a car merges into your lane without signaling?
choices: Honk your horn to alert the driver.
Brake hard and come to a stop.
Swerve to avoid the car.
Take your foot off the gas and let the car merge.

text: What should you do if you are driving and a car is tailgating you?
choices: Brake suddenly to get the car to back off.
Speed up to get away from the car.
Move to the right lane and let the car pass.
Stay in your current lane and ignore the car.

text: What should you do if you are driving and your car's brakes feel spongy?
choices: Ignore the problem and keep driving.
Pump the brakes to build up pressure.
Take your car to a mechanic as soon as possible.
Turn off the engine and coast to a stop.

text: What should you do if you are driving and your car's engine starts to smoke?
choices: Turn on the air conditioning to cool down the engine.
Stop the car and try to put out the fire.
Take your car to a mechanic as soon as possible.
Accelerate to get through the problem faster.

text: What should you do if you are driving and your car's oil pressure warning light comes on?
choices: Take your car to a mechanic as soon as possible.
Add more oil to the engine.
Turn off the engine and coast to a stop.
Accelerate to get through the problem faster.

text: What should you do if you are driving and your car's transmission starts to slip?
choices: Take your car to a mechanic as soon as possible.
Add more transmission fluid.
Turn off the engine and coast to a stop.
Accelerate to get through the problem faster.

text: What should you do if you are driving and the road is flooded?
choices: Accelerate to get through the water faster.
Brake hard and come to a stop.
Drive slowly and cautiously through the water.
Turn around and find an alternate route.

text: What should you do if you are driving and your car's alternator fails?
choices: Take your car to a mechanic as soon as possible.
Disconnect the battery and reconnect it.
Replace the alternator yourself.
Turn off the engine and coast to a stop.

text: What should you do if you are driving and your car's airbag deploys?
choices: Stop the car and call for help.
Continue driving as normal.
Pull over to a safe location and assess the damage.
Turn off the engine and wait for the airbag to deflate.
